Some of the most common contaminants found in water include heavy metals, pesticides, and microorganisms.

Microorganisms, such as bacteria, viruses, and parasites, can also pose a significant threat to human health. These illnesses can cause severe diarrhea, dehydration, and even death in extreme cases.
